conclusion: Analyze motion based on velocity-time graph to find time when particles A and B are farthest apart.
Graph shows velocity of particles A and B as a function of time.
Particle A's velocity increases linearly to 2v0 at t0, then decreases linearly to zero at 3t0.
Particle B's velocity increases linearly to v0 at t0, remains constant until 4t0, then decreases linearly to zero at 6t0.
Displacement is the area under the velocity-time graph.
Displacement of Particle A from 0 to t0 is v0t0.
Displacement of Particle A from t0 to 3t0 is 2v0t0.
Total displacement of Particle A at 3t0 is 3v0t0.
Displacement of Particle B from 0 to t0 is 0.5v0t0.
Displacement of Particle B from t0 to 4t0 is 3v0t0.
Displacement of Particle B from 4t0 to 6t0 is v0t0.
Total displacement of Particle B at 6t0 is 4.5v0t0.
At t0, displacement difference between A and B is 0.5v0t0.
At 2t0, displacement difference between A and B is -0.5v0t0.
At 3t0, displacement difference between A and B is -0.5v0t0.
At 4t0, displacement difference between A and B is -1.5v0t0.
At 5t0, displacement difference between A and B is -1.5v0t0.
At 6t0, displacement difference between A and B is -1.5v0t0.
